UsageÂ¶

The logic() method simplifies coding in the forms.py for “skip” logic so that you don’t need to write all the if/else statements.

In this example, field has_ga is a yes/no question that if answered ‘YES’ requires that you complete question ‘ga’ and if ‘NO’ that you don’t.

 class MaternalLabDelForm (BaseMaternalModelForm):

     def clean(self):
         cleaned_data = self.cleaned_data
         self.logic.test(cleaned_data, 'has_ga', 'YES', 'ga')

     class Meta:
         model = MaternalLabDel

See classes for more options.
